intro: Amesiella philippinensis var. monticola, commonly known as the Philippine mountain amesiella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves with a rough, textured surface. Its small, pale yellow flowers are typically arranged in clusters, and it produces capsules as its fruiting structure. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments.
